meanings.definition: The quality or state of being subtle.
meanings.sent1: She appreciated the subtleties of the painting, noticing the small details.
meanings.sent2: The subtleties of her expression revealed her true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The detective found humor in the subtleties of the crime scene, solving the case with ease.
meanings.sent4: The subtleties of the melody intertwined beautifully, creating a harmonious composition.
meanings.sent5: His success in negotiations was due to his understanding of the subtleties of human behavior.

meanings.sent1: The subtleties in flavor between the two dishes were hard to detect.
meanings.sent2: She could perceive the subtleties in the shades of blue paint.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the subtleties in the different types of coffee, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The subtleties in the texture of the fabric added depth to the design.
meanings.sent5: His success in the experiment was due to his attention to the subtleties of the data.
